# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    output_arr = Vector{String}(undef, 0)
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(output_arr, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line += " " * word
    end
    # append the last line if it was not written yet
    if current_line != ""
        push!(output_arr, current_line)
    end
    return join(output_arr)
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello World This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function will output the following, respecting the `text_width` of 10 characters per line:

```plaintext
Hello World
This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped at 10 characters per line.
```
